title: Revealed: The five countries where a strong pound is saving British tourists money
text:
The UK's Brexit journey has meant a tumultuous time for the value of holidaymakers' pound.

Travellers have had to withstand airport bureau de change outlets offering just €0.80 to the pound, and though rates are marginally improved, sterling remains nowhere near where it was before the EU referendum.

So how best can Britons make the most of whatever sterling rate befalls them at the time of their trip?

Below we run through some of the most common mistakes when it comes to acquiring, and spending, your holiday money, and the five destinations where the pound is still performing well.

Currency analysts Equals has said that "holiday spending complacency" costs Britons up to £14.3 billion every year. It has broken down our collective losses into six key points, with the amount of money each wastes across the country…
